example_sentences.eng_trans: fun; something enjoyable
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白いこと

example_sentences.eng_trans: have (some) fun playing with the children
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 子供たちを相手に何か面白いことをして遊ぶ

example_sentences.eng_trans: very [extremely, highly] enjoyable (cf. 2, 3)
example_sentences.jap_sentence: すごく面白い

example_sentences.eng_trans: what fun [a joy] (it is) to do!; it's great fun to do!; doing it is really enjoyable.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: …するのは本当に面白い

example_sentences.eng_trans: It's fun to run about in the snow.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 雪の中を走り回るのは面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: What fun [sport]! ｜ What a lark! ｜ How thrilling! (cf. 2, 3)
example_sentences.jap_sentence: まあ面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: I had a really good time [a lot of fun] yesterday.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 昨日は非常に面白かった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The picnic was great fun. ｜ We had a great [fantastic] time on the picnic.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ピクニックはとても面白かった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The game [match] was really [very, extremely] exciting. ｜ It was a really good [great] match.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 勝負は大変に面白かった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: It's such fun I can't stop. ｜ It is so enjoyable that I cannot give (it) up.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くてやめられない。

example_sentences.eng_trans: He seems to be addicted to TV games [find video games irresistible]. ｜ Apparently he gets a huge kick out of video games.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼はテレビゲームが面白くてしょうがないらしい。

example_sentences.eng_trans: He just loves politics. ｜ He finds so much pleasure in [gets so much pleasure out of] politics.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼は政治が面白くてたまらないのだ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Wouldn't it be fun if we could fly through the sky?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 空を飛べたら面白いでしょうね。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Was it fun? ｜ Did you have a good time? ｜ Did you enjoy yourself?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白かったか。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Was the concert fun? ｜ Was it a good concert? ｜ Did you enjoy the concert?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: コンサートは面白かったか。

example_sentences.eng_trans: What did you enjoy on the trip? ｜ What part of the trip was (the most) enjoyable?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 遠足では何が面白かった?

example_sentences.eng_trans: Do you really enjoy teasing ants? ｜ Is teasing ants really so much fun? ｜ Is it really so much fun to tease ants?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 君はアリをいじめて面白いと思うのか。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Once you try shōgi, you'll find it's quite a profound and exciting game.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 将棋はやってみるとけっこう奥が深くて面白いゲームだ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: No one will come to watch a dull [slow, lifeless] game.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くない試合はだれも見に来ない。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Nothing is fun without you, you know. ｜ We'll have no fun unless you come with us.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 君が一緒でないと面白くないよ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: a funny [an amusing] person; a person who makes one laugh (cf. 3)
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白い人

example_sentences.eng_trans: an extremely funny joke; a hilarious gag; a sidesplitter
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 非常に面白い冗談

example_sentences.eng_trans: an actor with an unusual voice
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白い声の声優

example_sentences.eng_trans: a funny gesture
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白いしぐさ

example_sentences.eng_trans: a funny cartoon [comic]
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白い漫画

example_sentences.eng_trans: very [extremely, highly] amusing; terribly funny. (cf. 1, 3)
example_sentences.jap_sentence: すごく面白い

example_sentences.eng_trans: How funny! ｜ What a laugh [hoot]! (cf. 1, 3)
example_sentences.jap_sentence: まあ面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: I tried to make the baby laugh by pulling (funny) faces.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私は面白い顔をして赤ちゃんを笑わせようとした。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Young people wearing funny clothes are showing (themselves) off around the town.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白い格好をした若者が町を闊歩している。

example_sentences.eng_trans: He is always funny [telling jokes], so he's popular in class.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼はいつも面白いことを言うからクラスの人気者だ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: That mountain has a funny [an odd, a curious, a strange] shape.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: あの山の形は面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Strangely [Oddly, Funnily] enough, a lizard's tail can grow again after being broken off.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白いことにはトカゲのしっぽは切れてもまた生えてくる。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Changing the packaging made it sell well [like hot cakes]. ｜ Once the packaging was changed, the item enjoyed better sales.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: パッケージを変えたら面白いように売れた。

example_sentences.eng_trans: There's a place where you can enjoy some good fishing.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白いように釣れる場所があるんだ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: an interesting [a good] story [talk]
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白い話

example_sentences.eng_trans: Any news? ｜ Anything new? ｜ Anything interesting to tell me [report]?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 何か面白い話でもないかね。

example_sentences.eng_trans: an interesting [a nice] person; a person with an attractive personality (cf. 2)
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白い人

example_sentences.eng_trans: He's fun. ｜ He's an interesting guy [chap].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白いやつだ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: He is good [not good] to be with. ｜ He is good [poor] company. ｜ It is [isn't] nice to be with him.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼はつきあっていて面白い[面白くない]人だ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: a good talker [conversationalist]; a person with a good sense of humor
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 話の面白い人

example_sentences.eng_trans: I've found out something interesting. ｜ I've made an interesting discovery.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白いことを発見した。

example_sentences.eng_trans: That's an interesting point (you've made). ｜ That's one to think about.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 君は面白いことを言うね。

example_sentences.eng_trans: interestingly enough; it's a funny thing that…; what is interesting is that…; an interesting fact is that…
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白いことには

example_sentences.eng_trans: a pine tree with an intriguing pattern of branches; an intriguingly shaped pine tree
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白い枝ぶりの松

example_sentences.eng_trans: a challenging golf course
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白いゴルフコース

example_sentences.eng_trans: an interesting [unusual] combination
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白い組み合わせ

example_sentences.eng_trans: 〈事が主語〉 become less interesting; lose 〈its〉 interest; flag; fall off; 〈人が主語〉 lose (one's) interest 《in…》
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くなくなる

example_sentences.eng_trans: As I don't understand equations, I've lost interest in math.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 方程式がわからなくて数学が面白くなくなってきた。

example_sentences.eng_trans: You must be fed up now that your work is losing its interest (for you).
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 仕事が面白くなくなってきたのは飽きてきたのでしょう。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Let's make a children's program that is both entertaining and educational [interesting and instructive] (at the same time).
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くてためになる子供番組を作ろう。

example_sentences.eng_trans: very [extremely, highly] interesting; most intriguing (cf. 1, 2).
example_sentences.jap_sentence: すごく面白い

example_sentences.eng_trans: How interesting! ｜ You don't say! (cf. 1, 2)
example_sentences.jap_sentence: まあ面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The interesting [intriguing] point about this book is that a cat is made to describe the hero's feelings.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: この本の面白い点は, 主人公の気持ちを猫に語らせているということです。

example_sentences.eng_trans: That's the interesting part about it. ｜ That's where the beauty of it all comes in. ｜ That's what makes it so interesting.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: (相撲は体重制限がなく, 小さい力士が大きい力士を負かすこともある。) そこが面白いところだ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: A lot of other interesting items were on display. ｜ There were many other exhibits of interest.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ほかにもたくさん面白いものが出品してあった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: That's a pretty good [attractive, interesting] idea. ｜ That's not a bad idea at all.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: それはなかなか面白い思いつきだ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: There are a lot of interesting [fascinating] animals in the zoo.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 動物園には面白い動物たちがたくさんいる。

example_sentences.eng_trans: This magazine is good reading [appeals to me].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: この雑誌は面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: It's very interesting to watch a baby. ｜ Watching a baby is absorbing.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 赤ん坊って見ているととても面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: That's why history is (so) interesting.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: だから歴史は面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Agriculture is now attracting (a lot of) interest.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 今農業が面白い。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Classes are boring [don't interest me].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 授業が面白くない。

example_sentences.eng_trans: an unfavorable [unsavory] reputation; an unpleasant rumor.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くない評判

example_sentences.eng_trans: "How's your business?"―"Not very [too] good."
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 「商売はどうだ」「あまり面白くない」

example_sentences.eng_trans: His condition is unfavorable [not reassuring]. ｜ He is in an unfavorable condition.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼の容体は面白くない。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The position [situation] is not encouraging. ｜ Things are not promising.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 〔チェス・囲碁などで〕 形勢は面白くない。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The result was not satisfactory. ｜ The results were not as I had hoped.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 結果は面白くなかった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Something unpleasant might happen. ｜ That might have awkward results.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くないことになるかもしれない。

parts: (通例は「面白くない」の形で) unpleasant

example_sentences.eng_trans: feel uncomfortable [embarrassed]; be upset; take offense.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くなく感じる

example_sentences.eng_trans: The boss's methods are unsatisfactory. ｜ I don't like the way the boss handles things.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 部長のやり方が面白くない。

example_sentences.eng_trans: I'm not happy [unhappy] about that junior member of the company getting promoted above me [a promotion ahead of me, a promotion before I did].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 後輩が先に昇進して, 僕は面白くない。

example_sentences.eng_trans: I didn't enjoy being left out. ｜ Being ignored upset me.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私はのけものにされて面白くなかった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Some unpleasant things were said to him, so, indignant [angry], he stomped out.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くないことを言われて, 彼は憤然と退席した。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Why that look on your face? Has something unpleasant happened?
example_sentences.jap_sentence: そんな顔をして何か面白くないことでもあったのかい。

example_sentences.eng_trans: I found it really unpleasant [quite upsetting] to have my faults pointed out in front of everyone.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: みんなの前で落ち度を指摘されて, 本当に面白くない思いをした。

example_sentences.eng_trans: With the latest incident, unpleasant feelings have been aroused between the two countries. ｜ The latest incident has caused bad blood [feelings to run high] between the two nations.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 今度の事件で両国民の間に面白くない感情が生じている。

example_sentences.eng_trans: enjoyably; pleasantly; agreeably; with enjoyment; with pleasure; funnily; amusingly; with [in] fun; with amusement; interestedly; with interest; with relish.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白く

example_sentences.eng_trans: a history book adapted to make it enjoyable for children [interesting to children]
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 子供向けに面白く書き換えた歴史本

example_sentences.eng_trans: I have read this book with great interest. ｜ I very much enjoyed (reading) this book. ｜ I found this book very interesting [enjoyable] (to read).
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 私はこの本を非常に面白く読んだ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: an intriguingly gnarled bonsai pine
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くねじれた松の盆栽

example_sentences.eng_trans: a garden laid with rocks in an intriguing pattern; a garden with rocks laid out in an interesting way [an interesting arrangement of rocks].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 石を面白く配置してある庭

example_sentences.eng_trans: make enjoyable [amusing, interesting].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くする

example_sentences.eng_trans: The teachers are doing their best to make their classes interesting [fun]. ｜ The teachers go to great lengths to add interest to their lessons.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 先生がたは一生懸命に授業を面白くする工夫をしている。

example_sentences.eng_trans: I tried to make my speech more amusing by putting in some jokes, but they fell flat (with the audience).
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 話を面白くしようとギャグを入れたら, かえって座がしらけてしまった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: be [become] (more) enjoyable [amusing, interesting].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白くなる

example_sentences.eng_trans: That made my trip much more pleasant. ｜ It added greatly [spice] to the pleasure of traveling.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: それで旅行が大変面白くなった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The class would be more fun if you could follow it. ｜ Being able to understand it would make the lesson more interesting.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: わかれば授業も面白くなる。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The revised rules made it easier to score, and volleyball became more fun (to watch).
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ルール改正により点が入りやすくなり, バレーボール(観戦)が面白くなった。

example_sentences.eng_trans: This book will grow upon you. ｜ The book will get better [more enjoyable] as [the more] you read it.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: この本は読んでいるうちにだんだん面白くなる。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The story has got more and more interesting.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 話がだんだん面白くなってきた。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Studying has become more enjoyable for me. ｜ I've begun to enjoy studying.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 勉強が面白くなってきた。

example_sentences.eng_trans: Things are getting interesting [warming up].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: こいつは面白くなってきたぞ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: With only a one-point difference, the game suddenly got more exciting [″hotted up].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 点差が 1 点になったので, がぜん試合が面白くなってきた。

example_sentences.eng_trans: It's a pity that time ran out just as the debate was getting interesting [heating up].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 討論が面白くなってきたところで時間切れになったのは残念だ。

example_sentences.eng_trans: appeal; attraction; interest.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白さ

example_sentences.eng_trans: the appeal [attraction, fascinating aspect(s)] of video games
example_sentences.jap_sentence: テレビゲームの面白さ

example_sentences.eng_trans: side-splitting fun; hilarity
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 抱腹絶倒の面白さ

example_sentences.eng_trans: Once you know who the culprit is, the interest wanes.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 犯人がわかると(推理小説を読む)面白さが半減する。

example_sentences.eng_trans: I've finally realized what fun soccer is. ｜ Now I know what it is that makes soccer so exciting.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: やっとサッカーの面白さがわかってきた。

example_sentences.eng_trans: It would be difficult to understand what is interesting about this movie without knowing American culture.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: この映画の面白さはアメリカの文化がわからないと理解できないだろう。

example_sentences.eng_trans: The book was so interesting that I got totally absorbed in it and forgot (about) the time.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: その本のあまりの面白さに, つい時間を忘れて読みふけってしまった。
面白そう

example_sentences.eng_trans: with (apparent) enjoyment [delight, pleasure]; merrily; pleasantly; delightedly; with (apparent) mirth; with (apparent) interest
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白そうに

example_sentences.eng_trans: Painting looks enjoyable [fun], but I wonder if it really is.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ペンキ塗りの仕事は面白そうに見えるが, 本当はどうだろうか。

example_sentences.eng_trans: swimming delightfully in the air [sky].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 〔唱歌『こいのぼり』の歌詞〕 (屋根より高いこいのぼり…) 面白そうに泳いでる

example_sentences.eng_trans: an enjoyable-looking play; an interesting-looking play
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白そうな芝居

example_sentences.eng_trans: (That) looks [sounds] like fun. ｜ That sounds enjoyable [a good idea]; That sounds interesting [an interesting idea].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白そうだね。

example_sentences.eng_trans: ⇒<reference>おもしろみ</reference=1c61e:33e>.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白み

example_sentences.eng_trans: ⇒<reference>おもしろがる</reference=1c61b:744>.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 面白がる
